intro: Thlaspi triangulare, commonly known as the triangular cress, is a small flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, with trifoliate leaves that are triangular in shape. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, and it produces round, smooth pods that contain several seeds. Thlaspi triangulare is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas.
